titleStmt.title: A representation from his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax, and the generall Councel of the Army. Expressing the desires of the Army in relation to themselves as souldiers; in which they desire satisfaction before disbanding. Tendred to the Right Honourable the Commissioners of Parliament residing with the Army, Sept. 21. to be by them represented to the Parliament. By the appointment of his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax and the generall councell of the Army. John Rushworth Secret.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Army. Council.

titleStmt.title: A representation from his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax, and the generall Councel of the Army. Expressing the desires of the Army in relation to themselves as souldiers; in which they desire satisfaction before disbanding. Tendred to the Right Honourable the Commissioners of Parliament residing with the Army, Sept. 21. to be by them represented to the Parliament. By the appointment of his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax and the generall councell of the Army. John Rushworth Secret.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Army. Council.
Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Partridge, in Black-fryers at the gate going into Carter-lane,

notesStmt.note: In this edition, line 14 on title page ends: Tho-.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
